title: Accidents on highways halved, says minister Aleem Khan - Pakistan - DAWN.COM
content:
ISLAMABAD: An incr­e­ase of 25 per cent traffic pressure has been witnes­sed on Pakistan’s highways over the past five years, but with effective measures and recent policies, road accidents decreased by 50 per cent while the rate of injuries and fatalities reduced by 30pc, Minister for Communica­tions, Privat­isation and Investment told a conference on Wednesday.

Speaking at the Fourth Global Ministerial Confe­rence on Road Safety, in Mar­rakech, Aleem Khan said that the government is implemen­ting various road safety and health-related initiatives, urban planning policies and environmental impro­v­e­m­ent measures in the country.

The communication mi­­n­­i­ster highlighted the dev­e­lopment of signal-free corridors in Lahore, Kara­chi and Islamabad and effo­rts to provide immediate relief through rescue services and air ambulan­ces in case of road accidents.

On the sidelines of the conference, the minister held meetings with ministers from various countries and World Bank officials.

Published in Dawn, February 20th, 2025
